author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: Important principles may, and must, be inflexible.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: I walk slowly, but I never walk backward.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: God always takes the simplest way.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: The only real valuable thing is intuition.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: When the solution is simple, God is answering.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: A man should look for what is, and not for what he thinks should be.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For while knowledge defines all we currently know and understand, imagination points to all we might yet discover and create.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Great ideas often receive violent opposition from mediocre minds.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Anyone who doesn't take truth seriously in small matters cannot be trusted in large ones either.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: Do something wonderful, people may imitate it.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.

author: Albert Schweitzer
quote: An optimist is a person who sees a green light everywhere, while the pessimist sees only the red spotlight... The truly wise person is colour-blind.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: Experience is not what happens to a man. It is what a man does with what happens to him.

author: Alexander Pope
quote: Blessed is the man who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.

author: Alexander the Great
quote: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.

author: Alexis Carrel
quote: All great men are gifted with intuition. They know without reasoning or analysis, what they need to know.

author: Alfred Sheinwold
quote: Learn all you can from the mistakes of others. You won't have time to make them all yourself.

author: Anais Nin
quote: The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.

author: Anatole France
quote: To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe.

author: Anatole France
quote: It is better to understand a little than to misunderstand a lot.

author: Anne Wilson Schaef
quote: Trusting our intuition often saves us from disaster.

author: Aristotle
quote: Well begun is half done.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: Every man takes the limits of his own field of vision for the limits of the world.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: Well done is better than well said.

author: Buckminster Fuller
quote: You never change things by fighting the existing reality. To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete

author: Byron Pulsifer
quote: The best teacher is experience learned from failures.

author: Byron Pulsifer
quote: To give hope to someone occurs when you teach them how to use the tools to do it for themselves.

author: Byron Pulsifer
quote: Courage is not about taking risks unknowingly but putting your own being in front of challenges that others may not be able to.

author: Byron Pulsifer
quote: Responsibility is not inherited, it is a choice that everyone needs to make at some point in their life.

author: Charles Chesnutt
quote: Impossibilities are merely things which we have not yet learned.

author: Chinese proverb
quote: Talk doesn't cook rice.

author: Dale Carnegie
quote: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.

author: Epictetus
quote: Keep silence for the most part, and speak only when you must, and then briefly.

author: Epictetus
quote: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: I like to listen. I have learned a great deal from listening carefully. Most people never listen.

author: Everett Dirksen
quote: I am a man of fixed and unbending principles, the first of which is to be flexible at all times.

author: Galileo Galilei
quote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.

author: Georg Lichtenberg
quote: I cannot say whether things will get better if we change; what I can say is they must change if they are to get better.

author: German proverb
quote: Silence is a fence around wisdom.

author: Gloria Steinem
quote: If the shoe doesn't fit, must we change the foot?

author: Henry Ford
quote: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.

author: John Powell
quote: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.

author: Margaret Mead
quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed. It is the only thing that ever has.

author: Mary Bethune
quote: Without faith, nothing is possible. With it, nothing is impossible.

author: Mary Kay Ash
quote: Aerodynamically the bumblebee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumblebee doesn't know that so it goes on flying anyway.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: I am always doing that which I can not do, in order that I may learn how to do it.

author: Philip Sidney
quote: Either I will find a way, or I will make one.

author: Plato
quote: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.

author: Ralph Emerson
quote: Skill to do comes of doing.

author: Rene Descartes
quote: Divide each difficulty into as many parts as is feasible and necessary to resolve it.

author: Richard Bach
quote: The simplest things are often the truest.

author: Robert Anthony
quote: Forget about all the reasons why something may not work. You only need to find one good reason why it will.

author: Robert Frost
quote: The best way out is always through.

author: Terry Tempest Williams
quote: Creativity involves breaking out of expected patterns in order to look at things in a different way.

author: Thomas Carlyle
quote: This world, after all our science and sciences, is still a miracle; wonderful, inscrutable, magical and more, to whosoever will think of it.

author: Unknown
quote: The definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting a different result.

author: Vernon Cooper
quote: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past, wisdom is of the future.

author: Jesus

quote: I didnâ€™t fail the test. I just found 100 ways to do it wrong.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Never promise more than you can perform.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
author: Laozi

quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
author: Isocrates

quote: Quick decisions are unsafe decisions.
author: Sophocles

quote: Great ideas often receive violent opposition from mediocre minds.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Technology has to be invented or adopted.
author: Jared Diamond

quote: It always seems impossible until it's done.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.
author: Archimedes

quote: Blessed is the man who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
author: Alexander Pope
Amar Bose
quote: If you think something is impossible, don't disturb the person doing it.

author: Lao Tse
quote: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.

author: John Dewey
quote: An ounce of experience is better than a ton of theory simply.

author: Paul Buchheit
quote: The first thing I do on day one is build something useful, then just keep improving it.

author: Samuel Goldwyn
quote: If I look confused it is because I am thinking.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: Creativity is just connecting things. When you ask creative people how they did something, they feel a little guilty because they didn't really do it, they just saw something. It seemed obvious to them after a while. That's because they were able to connect experiences they've had and synthesize new things.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: If you do something and it turns out pretty good, then you should go do something else wonderful, not dwell on it for too long. Just figure out whatâ€™s next.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

author: Reid Hoffman
quote: If youâ€™re not a embarrassed by the first version of your product, you launched to late.

author: Richard Brandson
quote: You earn trust by providing innovative, quality products and keeping your word.

author: Seneca The Younger
quote: While we teach, we learn.

author: Sophocles
quote: One must learn by doing the thing; for though you think you know it, you have no certainty until you try.

author: Galileo Galilei
quote: Mathematics is the alphabet that God used to describe the universe.
It always takes longer than you expect, even when you take into account Hofstadter's Law.
author: Hofstadter's Law

quote: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Rick Osborne

quote: I do not fear computers. I fear lack of them.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: Computer Science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Software is like entropy: It is difficult to grasp, weighs nothing, and obeys the Second Law of Thermodynamics; i.e., it always increases.
author: Norman Augustine

quote: Software is a gas; it expands to fill its container.
author: Nathan Myhrvold

quote: Standards are always out of date. That's what makes them standards.
author: Alan Bennett

quote: Physics is the universe's operating system.
author: Steven R Garman

quote: It's hardware that makes a machine fast. It's software that makes a fast machine slow.
author: Craig Bruce

quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited, whereas imagination embraces the entire world, stimulating progress, giving birth to evolution.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Getting information off the Internet is like taking a drink from a fire hydrant.
author: Mitchell Kapor

quote: If you think your users are idiots, only idiots will use it.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: From a programmer's point of view, the user is a peripheral that types when you issue a read request.

quote: Computers are good at following instructions, but not at reading your mind.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: There is only one problem with common sense; it's not very common.
author: Milt Bryce

quote: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Let us change our traditional attitude to the construction of programs: Instead of imagining that our main task is to instruct a computer what to do, let us concentrate rather on explaining to human beings what we want a computer to do.
author: Donald E. Knuth

quote: The Internet? We are not interested in it.
author: Bill Gates, 1993

quote: The best way to get accurate information on Usenet is to post something wrong and wait for corrections.
author: Matthew Austern

quote: The most likely way for the world to be destroyed, most experts agree, is by accident. That's where we come in; we're computer professionals. We cause accidents.
author: Nathaniel Borenstein

quote: Pessimists, we're told, look at a glass containing 50% air and 50% water and see it as half empty. Optimists, in contrast, see it as half full. Engineers, of course, understand the glass is twice as big as it needs to be.
author: Bob Lewis

quote: In a room full of top software designers, if two agree on the same thing, that's a majority.
author: Bill Curtis

quote: If you think you are worth what you know, you are very wrong. Your knowledge today does not have much value beyond a couple of years. Your value is what you can learn and how easily you can adapt to the changes this profession brings so often.
author: Jose M. Aguilar

quote: Commenting your code is like cleaning your bathroom : you never want to do it, but it really does create a more pleasant experience for you and your guests.
author: Ryan Campbell

quote: We have to stop optimizing for programmers and start optimizing for users.
author: Jeff Atwood

quote: Low
author: John Carmack

quote: It's OK to figure out murder mysteries, but you shouldn't need to figure out code. You should be able to read it.

quote: If we wish to count lines of code, we should not regard them as â€˜lines produced' but as â€˜lines spent.'

quote: Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however they should not be combined.

quote: Before software should be reusable, it should be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

quote: If you automate a mess, you get an automated mess.
author: Rod Michael

quote: Looking at code you wrote more than two weeks ago is like looking at code you are seeing for the first time.
author: Dan Hurvitz

quote: It is easier to change the specification to fit the program than vice versa.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: Less than 10% of the code has to do with the ostensible purpose of the system; the rest deals with input
author: Mary Shaw

quote: If you have a procedure with ten parameters, you probably missed some.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: How rare it is that maintaining someone else's code is akin to entering a beautifully designed building, which you admire as you walk around and plan how to add a wing or do some redecorating. More often, maintaining someone else's code is like being thrown headlong into a big pile of slimy, smelly garbage.

quote: Simplicity, carried to the extreme, becomes elegance.
author: Jon Franklin

quote: A program is never less than 90% complete, and never more than 95% complete.
author: Terry Baker

quote: When you are stuck in a traffic jam with a Porsche, all you do is burn more gas in idle. Scalability is about building wider roads, not about building faster cars.

quote: Everyone by now presumably knows about the danger of premature optimization. I think we should be just as worried about premature design
author: Paul Graham

quote: Programming without an overall architecture or design in mind is like exploring a cave with only a flashlight: You don't know where you've been, you don't know where you're going, and you don't know quite where you are.

quote: The best way to predict the future is to implement it.

quote: We need above all to know about changes; no one wants or needs to be reminded 16 hours a day that his shoes are on.
author: David Hubel

quote: Make everything as simple as possible, but not simpler.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Today, most software exists, not to solve a problem, but to interface with other software.

quote: The difference between theory and practice is that in theory, there is no difference between theory and practice.

quote: Don't document the problem, fix it.

quote: If the code and the comments do not match, possibly both are incorrect.

quote: I think it's a new feature. Don't tell anyone it was an accident.

quote: When debugging, novices insert corrective code; experts remove defective code.

quote: In a software project team of 10, there are probably 3 people who produce enough defects to make them net negative producers.

quote: Program testing can be a very effective way to show the presence of bugs, but is hopelessly inadequate for showing their absence.

quote: There's no obfuscated Perl contest because it's pointless.

quote: There are only two things wrong with C++: The initial concept and the implementation.

quote: Perl: The only language that looks the same before and after RSA encryption.

quote: BASIC is to computer programming as QWERTY is to typing.

quote: UNIX is simple. It just takes a genius to understand its simplicity.

author: Jamie Zawinski

quote: I think computer viruses should count as life. I think it says something about human nature that the only form of life we have created so far is purely destructive. We've created life in our own image.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: The only truly secure system is one that is powered off, cast in a block of concrete and sealed in a lead
author: Gene Spafford

quote: Being able to break security doesn't make you a hacker anymore than being able to hotwire cars makes you an automotive engineer.
author: Eric Raymond

quote: Companies spend millions of dollars on firewalls, encryption and secure access devices, and it's money wasted, because none of these measures address the weakest link in the security chain.

quote: If you think technology can solve your security problems, then you don't understand the problems and you don't understand the technology.

quote: Passwords are like underwear: you don't let people see it, you should change it very often, and you shouldn't share it with strangers.

quote: I am not out to destroy Microsoft, that would be a completely unintended side effect.

quote: Yes, we have a dress code. You have to dress.

quote: In an information economy, the most valuable company assets drive themselves home every night. If they are not treated well, they do not return the next morning.

quote: It's better to wait for a productive programmer to become available than it is to wait for the first available programmer to become productive.

quote: I'm not one of those who think Bill Gates is the devil. I simply suspect that if Microsoft ever met up with the devil, it wouldn't need an interpreter.

quote: Two years from now, spam will be solved.

quote: The problem of viruses is temporary and will be solved in two years.

quote: Computer viruses are an urban legend.

quote: In 2031, lawyers will be commonly a part of most development teams.

quote: In the future, computers may weigh no more than 1.5 tonnes.

quote: I see little commercial potential for the Internet for at least ten years.

quote: It's hardware that makes a machine fast. It's software that makes a fast machine slow.

quote: If the automobile had followed the same development cycle as the computer, a Rolls
author: Robert X. Cringely

quote: I've noticed lately that the paranoid fear of computers becoming intelligent and taking over the world has almost entirely disappeared from the common culture. Near as I can tell, this coincides with the release of MS

quote: The question of whether computers can think is like the question of whether submarines can swim.

quote: Never trust a computer you can't throw out a window.

quote: Hardware: The parts of a computer system that can be kicked.

quote: Most software today is very much like an Egyptian pyramid with millions of bricks piled on top of each other, with no structural integrity, but just done by brute force and thousands of slaves.

quote: True innovation often comes from the small startup who is lean enough to launch a market but lacks the heft to own it.

quote: It has been said that the great scientific disciplines are examples of giants standing on the shoulders of other giants. It has also been said that the software industry is an example of midgets standing on the toes of other midgets.

quote: It is not about bits, bytes and protocols, but profits, losses and margins.
author: Lou Gerstner

quote: No matter how slick the demo is in rehearsal, when you do it in front of a live audience, the probability of a flawless presentation is inversely proportional to the number of people watching, raised to the power of the amount of money involved.

quote: The bulk of all patents are crap. Spending time reading them is stupid. It's up to the patent owner to do so, and to enforce them.

quote: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.
author: Brian Kernigan

quote: Complexity kills. It sucks the life out of developers, it makes products difficult to plan, build and test, it introduces security challenges, and it causes end
author: Ray Ozzie

quote: There are two ways of constructing a software design. One way is to make it so simple that there are obviously no deficiencies. And the other way is to make it so complicated that there are no obvious deficiencies.

quote: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.

author: Walter Mossberg

quote: Software suppliers are trying to make their software packages more â€˜user

quote: Programmers are in a race with the Universe to create bigger and better idiot
author: Rich Cook

quote: Most of you are familiar with the virtues of a programmer. There are three, of course: laziness, impatience, and hubris.
author: Larry Wall

quote: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it's too late.
author: Seymour Cray

quote: That's the thing about people who think they hate computers. What they really hate is lousy programmers.
author: Larry Niven

quote: For a long time it puzzled me how something so expensive, so leading edge, could be so useless. And then it occurred to me that a computer is a stupid machine with the ability to do incredibly smart things, while computer programmers are smart people with the ability to do incredibly stupid things. They are, in short, a perfect match.

quote: Computer science education cannot make anybody an expert programmer any more than studying brushes and pigment can make somebody an expert painter.

quote: A hacker on a roll may be able to produce
author: Peter Seebach

quote: Don't worry if it doesn't work right. If everything did, you'd be out of a job.

quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.

quote: Writing code has a place in the human hierarchy worth somewhere above grave robbing and beneath managing.

quote: First learn computer science and all the theory. Next develop a programming style. Then forget all that and just hack.
author: George Carrett)

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.

quote: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming; feedback is the treatment.

quote: To iterate is human, to recurse divine.

quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.

quote: I think Microsoft named .Net so it wouldn't show up in a Unix directory listing.
author: Oktal

quote: There is no programming language

author: Richard A. O'Keefe

quote: Writing in C or C++ is like running a chain saw with all the safety guards removed.

quote: In C++ it's harder to shoot yourself in the foot, but when you do, you blow off your whole leg.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: C++ : Where friends have access to your private members.
author: Gavin Russell Baker

quote: One of the main causes of the fall of the Roman Empire was that
author: Robert Firth

quote: Java is, in many ways, C++
author: Michael Feldman

quote: Fine, Java MIGHT be a good example of what a programming language should be like. But Java applications are good examples of what applications SHOULDN'T be like.

quote: If Java had true garbage collection, most programs would delete themselves upon execution.
author: Robert Sewell

quote: The only people who have anything to fear from free software are those whose products are worth even less.
author: David Emery

quote: Good code is its own best documentation.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: Any code of your own that you haven't looked at for six or more months might as well have been written by someone else.
author: Eagleson's Law

quote: The first 90% of the code accounts for the first 90% of the development time. The remaining 10% of the code accounts for the other 90% of the development time.
author: Tom Cargill

quote: Good programmers use their brains, but good guidelines save us having to think out every case.
author: Francis Glassborow

quote: In software, we rarely have meaningful requirements. Even if we do, the only measure of success that matters is whether our solution solves the customer's shifting idea of what their problem is.

quote: Considering the current sad state of our computer programs, software development is clearly still a black art, and cannot yet be called an engineering discipline.

author: Brian Kernighan

quote: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.

quote: I don't care if it works on your machine! We are not shipping your machine!
author: Vidiu Platon

quote: There are two ways to write error

quote: You can either have software quality or you can have pointer arithmetic, but you cannot have both at the same time.

quote: If McDonalds were run like a software company, one out of every hundred Big Macs would give you food poisoning, and the response would be, â€˜We're sorry, here's a coupon for two more.'
author: Mark Minasi

quote: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Martin Golding

quote: To err is human, but to really foul things up you need a computer.
author: Paul Ehrlich

quote: A computer lets you make more mistakes faster than any invention in human history
author: Mitch Radcliffe

quote: It would appear that we have reached the limits of what it is possible to achieve with computer technology, although one should be careful with such statements, as they tend to sound pretty silly in 5 years.
author: John Von Neumann, circa 1949

quote: There is no reason for any individual to have a computer in his home.
author: Ken Olson, 1977

quote: 640K ought to be enough for anybody.
author: Bill Gates, 1981

quote: Windows NT addresses 2 Gigabytes of RAM, which is more than any application will ever need.
author: Microsoft, 1992

quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
author: Peter F. Drucker

quote: Continuous improvement is not about the things you do well
author: Bruce Hamilton

quote: If you need a new process and don't install it, you pay for it without getting it.
author: Ken Stork

quote: Everything can be improved.
author: Clarence W. Barron

quote: Amateurs work until they get it right. Professionals work until they can't get it wrong.
author: Author Unknown

quote: When solving problems, dig at the roots instead of just hacking at the leaves.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo, The College Blue Book

quote: A bad system will beat a good person every time.
author: W. Edwards Deming

quote: The first rule of any technology used in a business is that automation applied to an efficient operation will magnify the efficiency. The second is that automation applied to an inefficient operation will magnify the inefficiency.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Improvement usually means doing something that we have never done before.
author: Shigeo Shingo

quote: The impossible is often the untried.
author: Jim Goodwin

quote: The man who will use his skill and constructive imagination to see how much he can give for a dollar, instead of how little he can give for a dollar, is bound to succeed.
author: Henry Ford

quote: If you don't have time to do it right you must have time to do it over.
author: Author Unknown

quote: Different isn't always better, but better is always different.
author: Author Unknown

quote: If you can't describe what you are doing as a process, you don't know what you're doing.
author: W. Edwards Deming

quote: Innovation by definition will not be accepted at first. It takes repeated attempts, endless demonstrations, monotonous rehearsals before innovation can be accepted and internalized by an organization. This requires 'courageous patience'.
author: Warren Bennis

quote: Computer are like air conditioners: they stop working when you open windows.
author: Unknown

quote: Like car accidents, most hardware problems are due to driver error.
author: Unknown

quote: I didn't know it was impossible when I did it
author: Anomynous

quote: I try. I fail. I try again. I fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Algorithmic complexity for structured programmers: All algorithms are O(f(n)), where f is someone else's responsibility.
author: Peter Cooper

quote: Fact: 48% of IE7 usage comes from developers checking that their site works in IE7.
author: @iamdevloper

quote: Programmers don't burn out on hard work, they burn out on change
author: Mark Berry

quote: I've known people who have not mastered their tools who are good programmers, but not a tool master who remained a mediocre programmer.
author: Kent Beck

quote: There are two types of people in this world: those who understand recursion and those who don't understand that there are two types of people in this world.
author: Unknown

quote: Software developers like to solve problems. If there are no problems handily available, they will create their own problems.
author: Unknown

quote: The problem with quick and dirty, is that the dirty remains long after the quick has been forgotten
author: Steve C. McConnell

quote: Prolific developers don't always write a lot of code, instead they solve a lot of problems. The two things are not the same.
author: J. Chambers

quote: Bad programmers have all the answers. Good testers have all the questions.
author: Gil Zilberfeld

quote: Our job is to tell you your baby is ugly!
author: Software Testers

quote: One bad programmer can easily create two new jobs a year.
author: David Parnas

quote: Don't document bad code
author: Kernighan and Plauger

quote: Weeks of programming can save you hours of planning.
author: Anonymous

quote: If you think it's expensive to hire a professional, wait until you hire an amateur.
author: Unknown

quote: Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however they should not be combined.
author: Kreitzberg and Shneiderman

quote: The proper use of comments is to compensate for our failure to express ourself in code.
author: Uncle Bob Martin

quote: My definition of an expert in any field is a person who knows enough about what's really going on to be scared.
author: P. J. Plauger

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

quote: Programming is not a zero
author: John Carmack

quote: One of my most productive days was throwing away 1000 lines of code
author: Ken Thompson

quote: When in doubt, use brute force.
author: Ken Thompson

quote: Deleted code is debugged code.
author: Jeff Sickel

quote: The most effective debugging tool is still careful thought, coupled with judiciously placed print statements.
author: Brian W. Kernighan, 1979

quote: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: Beauty is more important in computing than anywhere else in technology because software is so complicated. Beauty is the ultimate defence against complexity.
author: David Gelernter

quote: UNIX was not designed to stop its users from doing stupid things, as that would also stop them from doing clever things.
author: Doug Gwyn

quote: Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: The unavoidable price of reliability is simplicity.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: You can't trust code that you did not totally create yourself.
author: Ken Thompson

quote: Compatibility means deliberately repeating other people's mistakes.
author: David Wheeler

quote: Debugging time increases as a square of the program's size.
author: Chris Wenham

quote: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

quote: The best code is no code at all.
author: Unknown

quote: No code is faster than no code.
author: merb motto

quote: Work expands so as to fill the time available for its completion.
author: Parkinson's Law

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: If we'd asked the customers what they wanted, they would have said faster horses
author: Henry Ford

quote: With diligence it is possible to make anything run slowly.
author: Tom Duff

quote: Software obeys the law of gaseous expansion
author: Larry Gleason

quote: A distributed system is one in which the failure of a computer you didn't even know existed can render your own computer unusable.
author: Leslie Lamport

quote: The proper use of comments is to compensate for our failure to express ourself in code.
author: Robert C. MartinClean Code

quote: Incorrect documentation is often worse than no documentation.
author: Bertrand Meyer

quote: Security is a state of mind.
author: NSA Security Manua

quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: Innovation is not about saying yes to everything. It's about saying NO to all but the most crucial features.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.
author: Brian Kernigan

quote: Nine people can't make a baby in a month.
author: Fred Brooks

quote: A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: A language that doesn't affect the way you think about programming is not worth knowing.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Computer science education cannot make anybody an expert programmer any more than studying brushes and pigment can make somebody an expert painter.
author: Eric S. Raymond

quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: In theory, theory and practice are the same. In practice, they're not.
author: Yoggi Berra

quote: You can't have great software without a great team, and most software teams behave like dysfunctional families.
author: Jim McCarthy

quote: The best programmers are not marginally better than merely good ones. They are an order
author: Randall E. Stross

quote: People think that computer science is the art of geniuses but the actual reality is the opposite, just many people doing things that build on each other, like a wall of mini stones.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Most of you are familiar with the virtues of a programmer. There are three, of course: laziness, impatience, and hubris.
author: Larry Wall

quote: Most good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, but because it is fun to program.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: If builders built buildings the way programmers wrote programs, then the first woodpecker that came along would destroy civilization.
author: Gerald Weinberg

quote: There are only two kinds of languages: the ones people complain about and the ones nobody uses.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: It's all talk until the code runs.
author: Ward Cunningham

quote: Being a good software engineer is 3% talent, 97% not being distracted by the internet.
author: Unknown

quote: A ship in port is safe, but that's not what ships are built for.
author: Grace Hopper

quote: Once a new technology starts rolling, if you're not part of the steamroller, you're part of the road.
author: Stewart Brand

quote: The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Simple things should be simple, complex things should be possible.
author: Cunningham

quote: I have yet to see any problem, however complicated, which, when you looked at it in the right way, did not become still more complicated.
author: Poul Anderson

quote: It's hard enough to find an error in your code when you're looking for it; it's even harder when you've assumed your code is error
author: Steve McConnell

quote: A good way to stay flexible is to write less code.
author: Pragmatic Programmer

quote: How does a project get to be a year late?... One day at a time.
author: Fred Brooks

quote: The best performance improvement is the transition from the nonworking state to the working state.
author: John Ousterhout

quote: If the code and the comments disagree, then both are probably wrong.
author: Norm Schryer

quote: If you can't write clearly, you probably don't think nearly as well as you think.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: You never actually find a perfect answer to a problem. You just find the answer that has the fewest problems.
author: James Gosling

quote: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one
author: Doug Linder

quote: A good scientist is a person with original ideas. A good engineer is a person who makes a design that works with as few original ideas as possible.
author: Freeman Dyson

quote: Making hackers work in a noisy, distracting environment is like having a paint factory where the air is full of soot.
author: Paul Graham

quote: In carpentry, you measure twice and cut once. In software development, you never measure and make cuts until you run out of time.
author: Adam Morse

quote: A Fallacy of Software: If it works, and we don't change anything, it will keep working.
author: Jessica Kerr

quote: Writing software as if we are the only person that ever has to comprehend it is one of the biggest mistakes and false assumptions that can be made.
author: Karolina Szczur

quote: Your code has two users: the computer, and every other person who has to work with what you wrote.
author: Sam Morgan

quote: In a complex system you don't get to change just one thing
author: Michael Feathers

quote: A distributed system is one in which the failure of a computer you didn't even know existed can render your own computer unusable.
author: Leslie Lamport

quote: Make sure you know what's inside the box before trying to think outside of it.
author: Unknown

quote: Rules of Optimization: Rule 1: Don't do it. Rule 2 (for experts only): Don't do it yet.
author: M.A. Jackson

quote: Correctness is clearly the prime quality. If a system does not do what it is supposed to do, then everything else about it matters little.
author: Bertrand Meyer

quote: An API that isn't comprehensible isn't usable.
author: James Gosling

quote: The bearing of a child takes nine months, no matter how many women are assigned. Many software tasks have this characteristic because of the sequential nature of debugging.
author: Fred Brooks

quote: It always takes longer than you expect, even when you take into account Hofstadter's Law.
author: Hofstadter's Law

quote: One principle problem of educating software engineers is that they will not use a new method until they believe it works and, more importantly, that they will not believe the method will work until they see it for themselves.
author: Humphrey, W.S.

quote: Incorrect documentation is often worse than no documentation.
author: Bertrand Meyer

quote: Plan to throw one (implementation) away; you will, anyhow.
author: Fred Brooks

quote: Remember that there is no code faster than no code.
author: Taligent's Guide to Designing Programs

quote: Smart data structures and dumb code works a lot better than the other way aroud.
author: Eric S. Raymond

quote: ... the cost of adding a feature isn't just the time it takes to code it. The cost also includes the addition of an obstacle to future expansion. ...The trick is to pick the features that don't fight each other.
author: John Carmack

quote: The fundamental problem with program maintenance is that fixing a defect has a substantial (20
author: Fred Brooks

quote: The difference between a good and a poor architect is that the poor architect succumbs to every temptation and the good one resists it.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Fools ignore complexity; pragmatists suffer it; experts avoid it; geniuses remove it.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Computer Science is the first engineering discipline in which the complexity of the objects created is limited solely by the skill of the creator, and not by the strength of raw materials.
author: B. Reid

quote: Technical skill is mastery of complexity, while creativity is mastery of simplicity.
author: E. Christopher Zeeman

quote: Architect: Someone who knows the difference between that which could be done and that which should be done.
author: Larry McVoy

quote: There's an old story about the person who wished his computer were as easy to use as his telephone. That wish has come true, since I no longer know how to use my telephone.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof was to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Good programmers know what to write. Great ones know what to rewrite (and reuse).
author: Unknown

quote: If you lie to the compiler, it will get its revenge.
author: Henry Spencer

quote: Trying to outsmart a compiler defeats much of the purpose of using one.
author: Kernighan and Plauger

quote: Once a new technology starts rolling, if you're not part of the steamroller, you're part of the road.
author: Stewart Brand

quote: Good engineering is not primarily making good decisions, it's seeking good feedback which lets you quickly discard bad decisions.
author: Kent Beck

quote: We just have to accept that developer skill is a far more significant variable than language choice or methodological nuances.
author: Michael Feathers

quote: When someone says, I want a programming language in which I need only say what I want done, give him a lollipop.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: Every program is a part of some other program and rarely fits.
author: Unknown

quote: Every program has (at least) two purposes: the one for which it was written, and another for which it wasn't.
author: Alan J. Perlis

quote: Technology is dominated by two types of people: Those who understand what they do not manage. Those who manage what they do not understand.
author: Putt's Law

quote: The perfect project plan is possible if one first documents a list of all the unknowns.
author: Bill Langley

quote: Program testing can be used to show the presence of bugs, but never to show their absence!
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: A Perl program is correct if it gets the job done before your boss fires you.
author: Larry Wall

quote: The evolution of languages: FORTRAN is a non
author: Ron Sercely

quote: He who hasn't hacked assembly language as a youth has no heart. He who does as an adult has no brain.
author: John Moore

quote: Don't get suckered in by the comments ... they can be terribly misleading.
author: Dave Storer

quote: If something is worth doing once, it's worth building a tool to do it.
author: Unknown

quote: If you think good architecture is expensive, try bad architecture.
author: Brian Foote and Joseph Yoder

quote: Beware of bugs in the above code; I have only proved it correct, not tried it.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: The ideal engineer is a composite ... he is not a scientist, he is not a mathematician, he is not a sociologist, or a writer; but he may use the knowledge and techniques of any or all of these disciplines in solving engineering problems.
author: N. W. Dougherty

quote: Good engineering is characterized by gradual, stepwise refinement of products that yields increased performance under given constraints and with given resources.
author: Niklaus Wirth

quote: Programming languages should be designed not by piling feature on top of feature, but by removing the weaknesses and restrictions that make additional features appear necessary.
author: Revised Report on the Algorithmic Language Scheme

quote: The problem with using C++ ... is that there's already a strong tendency in the language to require you to know everything before you can do anything.
author: Larry Wall

quote: We try to solve the problem by rushing through the design process so that enough time is left at the end of the project to uncover the errors that were made because we rushed through the design process.
author: Glenford Myers

quote: First you listen to the users; then you ignore them.
author: Ken Arnold

quote: The hardest part of design ... is keeping features out.
author: Donald Norman

quote: Computers are high
author: Unknown

quote: You know you're on the right track with code changes when you spend the majority of your time deleting code.
author: Unknown

quote: The key to understanding recursion is to begin by understanding recursion. The rest is easy.
author: Koenig/Moo

quote: Programs should be written and polished until they acquire publication quality.
author: Niklaus Wirth

quote: ... programming requires more concentration than other activities. It's the reason programmers get upset about 'quick interruptions'
author: Steve McConnell

quote: If at first you don't succeed, call it version 1.0.
author: Pat Rice

quote: It's not the prevention of bugs but the recovery the ability to gracefully exterminate them
author: Victoria Livschitz

quote: Every big computing disaster has come from taking too many ideas and putting them in one place.
author: Gordon Bell

quote: Hiring people to write code to sell is not the same as hiring people to design and build durable, usable, dependable software.
author: Larry Constantine

quote: A primary cause of complexity is that software vendors uncritically adopt almost any feature that users want.
author: Niklaus Wirth

quote: A dynamic duo who work well together can be worth any three people working in isolation.
author: Larry Constantine

quote: Wirth's law: Software gets slower faster than hardware gets faster.
author: Niklaus Wirth

quote: Documentation is the castor oil of programming. Managers think it is good for programmers and programmers hate it!
author: Gerald Weinberg

quote: The best way to get a project done faster is to start sooner.
author: Jim Highsmith

quote: Good code is its own best documentation. As you're about to add a comment, ask yourself, How can I improve the code so that this comment isn't needed?' Improve the code and then document it to make it even clearer.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: It's OK to figure out murder mysteries, but you shouldn't need to figure out code. You should be able to read it.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later!
author: Brooks Law

quote: It's better to wait for a productive programmer to become available than it is to wait for the first available programmer to become productive.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: In software, the chain isn't as strong as its weakest link; it's as weak as all the weak links multiplied together.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: The most important single aspect of software development is to be clear about what you are trying to build.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: I think it's a new feature. Don't tell anyone it was an accident.
author: Larry Wall

quote: Theory is when you know something, but it doesn't work. Practice is when something works, but you don't know why. Programmers combine theory and practice: Nothing works and they don't know why.
author: Unknown

quote: For every complex problem there is an answer that is clear, simple, and wrong.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Good programmers use their brains, but good guidelines save us having to think out every case.
author: Francis Glassborow

quote: Up to a point, it is better to just let the snags [bugs] be there than to spend such time in design that there are none.
author: Alan M. Turing

quote: Don't document bad code
author: Kernighan and Plauger

quote: You cannot teach beginners top
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: A complex system that works is invariably found to have evolved from a simple system that works.
author: John Gall

quote: Adding last
author: John Robbins

quote: Inside every large program, there is a small program trying to get out.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: The software isn't finished until the last user is dead.
author: Anonymous

quote: Why do we never have time to do it right, but always have time to do it over?
author: Anonymous

quote: Better train people and risk they leave
author: Anonymous

quote: There is not now, and never will be, a language in which it is the least bit difficult to write bad programs.
author: Anonymous

quote: A program is never less than 90% complete, and never more than 95% complete.
author: Terry Baker

quote: Bugs lurk in corners and congregate at boundaries.
author: Boris Beizer

quote: Agile methods derive much of their agility by relying on the tacit knowledge embodied in the team, rather than writing the knowleadge down in plans.
author: Barry Boehm

quote: Just because you don't know a technology, doesn't mean you won't be called upon to work with it.
author: Mike Bongiovanni

quote: The most likely way for the world to be destroyed, most experts agree, is by accident. That's where we come in; we're computer professionals. We cause accidents.
author: Nathaniel S. Borenstein

quote: Any sufficiently advanced bug is indistinguishable from a feature.
author: Bruce Brown

quote: Analysis occurs only when the domain expert is in the room (otherwise it is pseudo
author: Brad Kain

quote: When to use iterative development? You should use iterative development only on projects that you want to succeed.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: All programming is maintenance programming, because you are rarely writing original code.
author: Dave Thomas

quote: Java is to JavaScript what Car is to Carpet.
author: Tom Cargill

quote: Linux is only free if your time has no value.
author: Jamie Zawinski

quote: It works on my machine.
author: Every programmer

quote: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint ExupÃ©ry

quote: I Hate Programming. I Hate Programming. I Hate Programming. It works! I Love Programming.
author: Unknown

quote: Perl
author: Keith Bostic

quote: I invented the term Object
author: Alan Kay

quote: Engineers are all basically high
author: Cory Doctorow

quote: Vi is a subset of evil
author: Unknown

quote: Debuggers don't remove bugs. They only show them in slow motion.
author: Unknown

quote: Never trust a programmer in a suit.
author: Unknown

quote: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it's too late.
author: Seymour Cray

quote: Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning.
author: Unknown

quote: If Java had true garbage collection, most programs would delete themselves upon execution.
author: Robert Sewell

quote: My definition of an expert in any field is a person who knows enough about what's really going on to be scared.
author: P. J. Plauger

quote: An expert is a man who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field
author: Niels Bohr

quote: XML is like violence
author: Unknown

quote: There are 10 types of people in the world, those who can read binary, and those who can't.
author: Unknown

quote: We better hurry up and start coding, there are going to be a lot of bugs to fix.
author: Unknown

quote: UNIX is basically a simple operating system, but you have to be a genius to understand the simplicity.
author: Dennis Ritchie

quote: Better train people and risk they leave
author: Anonymous

quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
author: Douglas Adams

quote: Owning a computer without programming is like having a kitchen and using only the microwave oven
author: Charles Petzold

quote: If I had more time, I would have written a shorter letter.
author: Cicero

quote: You start writing code, I'll go see what the customer wants
author: Product Owner

quote: Good programmers never write what they can steal or borrow
author: Jeff Atwood

quote: ... one of the main causes of the fall of the Roman Empire was that, lacking zero, they had no way to indicate successful termination of their C programs.
author: Robert Firth.

quote: There are only two hard problems in Computer Science: cache invalidation and naming things.
author: Phil Karlto

quote: Nothing is more permanent than a temporary solution
author: Thomas' First Law

quote: It should work!
author: a programmer's last words.

quote: My programs don't have bugs, they just develop random features
author: Unknown

quote: I don't care if it works on your machine! We are not shipping your machine!
author: Ovidiu Platon

quote: One man's constant is another man's variable.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: Real Programmers don't comment their code. If it was hard to write, it should be hard to understand.
author: Unknown

quote: The more bizarre the behavior, the more stupid the mistake.
author: Ed's Law of Debugging

quote: No one hates software more than software developers.
author: Jeff Atwood

quote: Anything that can go wrong, will go wrong.
author: Murphy's Law

quote: If we can't fix it, then it ain't broke.
author: Unknown
